column5: my new to me bow rider is curently being covered by a big grey tarp  I think it needs a boat cover I'd really like a custom mooring cover but dont think it will fit budget  what are people buying that make them happy and work/last

I went with a mooring cover plus a full stand-up cover for my boat and am very happy with everything.  It's the Sunbrella material and was made by a fella that contracted with Hastings Marine although I don't think he's there anymore, but you could call them if interested.
That's a very nice boat Lew.
Nothing beats custom cover, but they are expencieve. I am using heavy duty storm pro from princess auto.
Love the way you mounted that rod holder Lew! Just gave me an idea.  As for covers, don't cheep out, you'll regret it in the end!
Otherwise off the shelf costco or princess auto is a good choice.

You are looking at over 1k for a custom mooring cover for a bowrider, depends on the size and the material. A cover from CT or PA will be a stop gap measure while you save up for a more permanent solution.

Save your money and grief and don't but anything from Canadian tire or any big box stores. I went to see Greg at Cover Unlimited in Brampton for a custom cover. I promise he will take good care of you and does 110% work.  Good luck
